snippet: Facebook employees weren’t directed to squelch conservative news on the site’s Trending Topics, nor would that be easily accomplished by a staff member who wished to do so.
abstract: Current and former Facebook employees, interviewed in connection with accusations company intentionally suppresses conservative news stories, say company's Trending Topics feature began as pilot operation using recent college graduates who were inappropriately given judgment over which news stories to cover; Facebook executives agree that many aspects of company's news curation policies and procedures are wrong and need to be fixed.
lead_paragraph: Facebook employees weren’t directed to squelch conservative news on the site’s Trending Topics, nor would that be easily accomplished by a staff member who wished to do so.

headline.main: Facebook ‘Trending’ List Skewed by Individual Judgment, Not Institutional Bias
headline.print_headline: At Facebook, Human Backup  for Algorithms Proved Fallible
